intro: Sideroxylon meyeri, commonly known as the African ironwood, is a member of the Sapotaceae family. It is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa, characterized by its dense, hard wood that is highly valued for its durability. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It produces small, yellowish flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits containing a single seed. The tree is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats.
